outcome_var: Default is coded 1; never having defaulted is coded 0
outcome_description: Used as a measure of cooperation. As defined by Working Capital, default occurs when a member's loan payment is 120 or more days past due. By defaulting on a loan, a group member essen- tially eliminates other group members' access to loans.
predictor_var: Number of years the borrowing group has existed
covariate_2: Ever having received a loan is coded 1; never having received a loan is coded 0
covariate_3: Total number of loans obtained by other members of the respondent's group
covariate_4: Gender - 1 for female and 0 for male

outcome_var: 1 if group has repaid its loan
predictor_var: number of years of existence of a group
covariate_1: average age of farmers in a group
covariate_2: marital status of cooperative group farmers
covariate_3: polarity of religious background of a group
covariate_4: technical capability of a group leader
covariate_7: varieties of crops cultivated by a group

outcome_var: 1 if the group succeeds in respecting his contract towards the lender, otherwise 0
outcome_description: External Delinquency replicated the second stage of the repayment decision when the repayment was due
predictor_var: Length (in month) during which the borrower was member of his group to the deadline of the loan
predictor_info: Used as a measure of social ties
covariate_1: The average distance (in meter) between the member and the other group members
covariate_2: 1 if the group has regulations and internal laws to reach there
covariate_3: 1 if all group members have the same business
covariate_4: 1 if the group members visit each other
covariate_5: 1 if the member knows the other group members before the formation of the group
covariate_6: The length in number of year spent by the borrower in the same region
covariate_7: 1: will to make pressure to incite repayment
covariate_8: 1 if the group rejects a borrower who wants to join it
covariate_9: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same age (+/-2 years)
covariate_10: 1 if all the group have the same sex
covariate_11: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same level of education
covariate_13: 1 if the group member is female
covariate_14: 1 if the borrower has at least 6 years of education
covariate_15: 1 if the group member is married
covariate_16: 1 if the group member has other sources of money
covariate_17: number of members in the group
covariate_18: 1 if the MFI puts at the disposal of borrowers non financial services
covariate_19: 1 if the borrower would have liked to borrow more than the assigned amount
covariate_20: 1 if the relation is very intimate, 0 elsewhere

model_type: Logistic regression with fixed effect for group
outcome_var: 1 if every monthly repayment is on time; otherwise 0
outcome_description: dummy variable of repaying on time
predictor_var: The period time during which a lending group exists or continues
predictor_info: Used as a measure of peer monitoring
covariate_1: 1 when certain consanguinity relationship or geographical relationship among group-lending members are certified; otherwise 0
covariate_2: 1 if members in a given group-lending operate similar busi- nesses or do similar jobs; otherwise it is 0
covariate_3: 1 when group lending members live in the same street or village; otherwise it is 0
covariate_4: Economic status of borrower: based on the ratio of per capita net income of the borrower‚Äôs family to the average per capita net income of the region. If the ratio is less than 0.8, the value of the indicator is 1; if the ratio is between 0.8 and 1.5, the value is 2; if the ratio is greater than 1.5, the value is 3
covariate_5: Gender: 1 means female, and 0 for male.
covariate_6: Education level: We assign 1, 2 or 3 to the education level respectively if the borrower‚Äôs years of education reach primary school level or below, middle school level, or college level and above
covariate_7: Marital status: if the borrower has married, value is set to 1. Otherwise 0
covariate_10: 1 if group lending member has other access to financing, otherwise 0
covariate_11: If the group lending targets at the field of agriculture, it is given 0, otherwise 1
covariate_12: natural logarithm of the total private assets of borrower
covariate_13: Duration of borrower‚Äôs sole proprietorship; if a borrower has no sole proprietorship, it equals to 0
covariate_14: Equals 1 if member‚Äôs businesses is production- oriented; else 0 denoting sale oriented
covariate_15: Dummy variable for year in which repayment was recorded

outcome_var: 1 if the loan is fully repaid within specified period of time, otherwise zero
outcome_description: Measure of loan group repayment performance
predictor_var: number of years the group has participated in the credit programme of a given MFI
covariate_1: education level of the group leader, measured by the number of completed years while schooling
covariate_2: 1 if group leader was female, otherwise zero
covariate_3: amount of time (in weeks) that the MFI devoted to training the group members on issues like loan management, group membership, sanctions and basic record keeping.
covariate_4: travelling costs (in Tanzanian shillings) incurred by the group for arranging, acquisition and repaying the loan
covariate_5: perception of members of the group of the impending threat of action against them in the event that they default in repaying the loan
covariate_6: whether members of the group have similar socio-economic background
covariate_8: number of people that form a particular group
covariate_9: number of members in group in 2010
covariate_10: square of number of members in group in 2010

outcome_var: 1 if a group had at least one late repayment and 0 if the group paid all installments on time up until the survey interview took place (over the last nine months)
outcome_description: Suvery question: In the last 9 months, is there any group member who has an outstanding debt?
predictor_var: Number of years since the group took its first loan to the day the survey was conducted
covariate_1: 1 if at least one member has an informal source of credit
covariate_2: 1 if members are of the same sex
covariate_3: 1 if members belong to the same ethnic group
covariate_4: 1 if members are of the same religion
covariate_5: 1 if members live in the same district and know each other before forming the group
covariate_6: 1 if members have the same occupations
covariate_7: 1 if members apply social pressure on defaulters
covariate_8: 1 if the monthly visits between members are greater than or equal to 7
covariate_9: 1 if the average distance between members businesses is greater than or equal to one km
covariate_10: Number of people in the group
covariate_11: 1 if members have ever rejected someone who would like to join the group

outcome_var: 1 if the borrower mentioned encountering at least one repayment problem during the past two loan cycles, and 0 if the borrower reported no problems with repaying
outcome_description: we identify whether the borrower faced at least one of the following situations during the past two loan cycles: ‚ÄòI had to borrow money from someone else in order to repay at least one instalment‚Äô; ‚ÄòI had to withdraw my savings in order to pay at least one instalment‚Äô; ‚ÄòI quarrelled/had arguments/disputed with my spouse or other family members because of difficulties to repay the loan that I took‚Äô; ‚ÄòI had to sell some household assets to repay at least one of the instalments‚Äô; ‚ÄòI had to make personal sacrifices (eat less/withdraw children from school/neglect my health) to repay at least one of the instalments‚Äô; ‚ÄòOther problems‚Äô. [This measure] distinguishes borrowers who encounter problems to repay their loans from borrowers who do not experience problems repaying their loans. We select this variable to measure the repayment problems of borrowers, because all borrowers in our sample have a clean portfolio, that is, they always manage to find a solution to repay their loans. This suggests that problems with loan repayment borrowers are faced with are due to cash flow management problems, instead of failing to make the necessary repayments.
predictor_var: Age of the group in months
covariate_1: number of ties an individual outside the group has with two members of the same borrowing group
covariate_2: number of strong external ties (ties with community members outside the borrowing group embedding valuable resources) shared with another group member
covariate_3: Number of individuals outside the group from which the individual could borrow a small amount of money
covariate_4: Number of individuals outside the group from which the individual could borrow a large amount of money
covariate_5: Number of individuals outside the group who could take care of the borrower's kids or house if she is sick or away for some time
covariate_6: 1 if the group borrower is part of any other formal network (except Pro Mujer), 0 otherwise
covariate_7: 1 if the group borrower is part of any informal network, 0 otherwise
covariate_8: The number of strong internal ties of borrower i
covariate_9: In your view, the microcredit activity is: 1 = Very useful (It helps people develop their businesses and improve their lives); 2 = Useful (It has positive outcomes for some individuals, but does not make any difference in other individuals' lives); 3 = Somewhat useful (It is neither a good or bad activity. Mostly, it does not make people better off or worse off); 4 = Not so useful (It does good for some people, but most people do not have the ability to use it wisely and end up worse off); 5 = Not useful (It is a dreadful activity. It harms people. I do not know anyone who got better off because of microcredit)
covariate_10: 1 if social santions were applied to defaulters
covariate_11: 1 = Less willing, 0 = More or equally willing
covariate_12: 1 = A great deal of confidence, 4 = None at all
covariate_13: Importance of access to future credit from Pro Mujer: 1= Very important, 5= Not important at all
covariate_16: Number of years the borrower has been living in the current area
covariate_17: 1 = Married or Cohabiting, 0 = Single, Divorced or Widowed
covariate_19: 1 = No education; 2 = Primary school, 3 = Secondary school, 4 = Preparatory/Vocational; 5 = University degree; 6 = Postgraduate
covariate_21: Number of household members older than 60 years
covariate_23: Number of household members having a fixed income
covariate_25: Current loan amount with Pro Mujer in pesos
covariate_26: Do you have other loans? 1 = Yes, 0 = No
covariate_27: Do you receive government help/subsidies? 1 = Yes, 0 = No
covariate_28: Have you received remittances during the last 12 months? 1 = Yes, 0 = No
covariate_29: Number of months the current loan officer has been in charge of the group
covariate_30: The group was initiated by: 1 = Loan officer/Pro Mujer, 0 = Borrowers
covariate_31: Net loan amount received by the whole group
covariate_32: Monthly interest rate for the current loan
covariate_33: Number of installments/payments in which the group loan will be repaid
covariate_34: Number of members in the group

outcome_var: 1 if group has average arrears of < 3 days per loan and no loans in arrears > 7 days
outcome_description: A group received a dummy variable equal to one if they were by FUNDAP's own criteria, a `problem-free' group. These groups had never been more than seven days late with any loan, and had average arrears of less than three days per loan.
predictor_var: Number of years since borrowing group took first group loan
covariate_1: 1 if group consists of either all men or all women.
covariate_2: Number of years members acquainted before group
covariate_3: 1 if all members say all were friends before group
covariate_4: 1 if members partake in joint social activities
covariate_5: 1 if willingness to pressure others to repay
covariate_6: 1 if members feel applying sanctions dif¬Æcult
covariate_7: Number of members in borrowing group
covariate_8: 1 if state moral obligation to repay group loan
covariate_9: 1 if say repay to stay on good terms with group
covariate_10: Average distance in kilometers between members' businesses
covariate_11: 1 if members know weekly sales of other members
covariate_12: 1 if members engaged in same line of business
covariate_13: 1 if at least one member has other credit access
covariate_14: Number of months in term of group loan

outcome_var: 1 for group members that had unresolved repayment problems after due date
covariate_1: 1 if borrower knew other members’ activities
covariate_2: 1 if borrower thinks he/she joined its “optimum” group
covariate_4: Distance (in KM) between major economic activities of group members
covariate_5: 1 if repay only because of moral obligation
covariate_6: 1 if borrower feels asset confiscation/prison is worst penalty upon default (compared to subsequent social problems)
covariate_7: 1 if participated in networks (e.g., Equb, Edir, Tsebel, etc.) with one or more group members
covariate_8: 1 if other (informal) sources of credit exist

outcome_description: Delinquency is not paying a loan repayment installment on time according to a predetermined schedule... Peer groups were coded for whether they had experienced loan delinquency or default but not for the frequency of occurrence
covariate_1: High costs of nonrepayment and benefits of repayment
covariate_7: Average credit risk of members in the same group
covariate_8: Percentage of women in a group
covariate_10: Group members' prior experience times number of years in business

outcome_var: 1 if the borrower made timely repayment, and 0 if the borrower delayed repayment.
covariate_5: 1 if native and 0 if non native
covariate_7: Amount of money invested, in Ghanaian cedi
covariate_8: 1 if able to access market for the sale of their produce and 0 otherwise
covariate_10: Amount of money earned per month, in Ghanaian cedi
covariate_11: number of loans provided to borrowers within a particular period
covariate_12: Amount of money received, in Ghanaian cedi

outcome_var: 1 if the loan was fully repaid within the specified period of the loan contract, otherwise 0
predictor_var: Age of loan group in years
covariate_2: Level of adherence to internal rules and regulations
covariate_3: 1 if loan group carried out a market study before formation
